The Objective of Pearl Vocational Centre, an initiative of Pearl Special Needs Foundation is to continue to impart pre-vocational and vocational skills training to the special needs youth, and provide opportunities for internship and work in sheltered, supervised or open market employment according to beneficiary. The Objective of Pearl Vocational Centre, an initiative of PSNF is to continue to impart pre-vocational and vocational skills training to the special needs youth, and provide opportunities for internship and work in sheltered, supervised or open market employment according to the beneficiary. ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Our organization is implementing Krishi Vigyan Kendra (KVK) â€“ A cent percent granted plan scheme of ICAR, New Delhi since 1992 at Mundra, Dist. Kutch of Gujarat. We developed local elite varieties of dateplm plants by establishing Datepalm Tissue Culture Laboratory at Mundra of Kutch district. The organization was recognized with Plant Protection Community Souvenir Award 2012 by Plant Protection Varieties and Farmersâ€™ Right Authority (PPV & FRA), New Delhi for outstanding work of conservation & dissemination of local elite datepalm Germplasm for serving farming community. We developed PVC Hand pollinator to pollinate female flowers of date trees without climbing on trees having thorny leaves. The organization was awarded by plast India foundation, Mumbai with Plast India Award 1997 for best use of plastic in Agriculture. As the water conservation is the priority thrust area of the organization, we implemented 22 watershed area development projects covering about 12.50 thousand hectare land to conserve natural water resources through the financial assistance of District Watershed Development Unit. The organization constructed 14 Roof Top Rain Water Harvesting structures in village schools buildings in Mundra and Mandvi talukas of Kutch district. Our organization built up 07 medium size check dams on different 05 rivers of Mundra, Mandvi and Anjar talukas of Kutch district through the financial help of Water and Sanitation Management Organization of Gujarat state. In 2001, the earthquake rehabilitation works like renovation, retrofitting, new housing construction and temporarily shelters were done by the organization in surrounding villages in physical and financial coordination with TVS Shrinivasan Memorial Trust, Channai, HDFC and Plast India Foundation, Mumbai. The organization has well equipped soil & water testing laboratory, Dairy and farm demonstration unit and Custom Hiring Center of farm machineries for serving farmers of surrounding villages. Our organization is continuous supporting the Prime Minister Swatchh Bharat Abhiyan through preparation of Toilet blocks in surrounding villages of nearby talukas of Kutch district with some financial support.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Main features of the constitution/Byelaws The institution is promoted by Matushri Chandramati Pratishthan, which has very broad objectives encompassing all types of activities. The resolution of this effect clearly mentions the objectives of the institution. There is a special focus on development of rural entrepreneurship micro enterprises and income generation activities in rural areas. It also emphasizes on creation of information and database on rural areas. The governing council appointed by mother trust will decide the activities to be undertaken by the trust. The institute will have its separate bank account. However, for all the financial formalities, the institute will be treated as part of Matushri Chandramati Pratishthan and so its accounts will form part of the balance sheet of Matushri Chandramati Pratishthan. A copy of byelaws it attached herewith. Mission of the organization To help development of rural areas and rural population through mainly capacity building and information, dissemination, seminars, employment generation, activities management, research for development and evaluation of various developments schemes conducting workshops and training. Objectives of the Organization The Instituteâ€™s major objective is to function as an agency to promote Rural Development in the following manner: (a) To identify areas of industrial / agricultural, economic and educational growth where there are possibilities of development in rural areas (b) To conduct specialized training programmes which can encourage or assist the rural development in the areas mentioned above (c) To organize and motivate the activities which would help in accelerating the rural development programmes (d) To conduct specialized studies and research which may be directly or indirectly related to the rural development activities (e) To assist the rural folks in building up sufficient funds for economic, social and cultural activities for their day to day needs Brief history of the organization Rural Development and Management Institute was promoted by Matushri Chandramati Pratishthan in 1997 with a view to help development of rural areas by providing professional inputs required in policy and programme planning implementation monitoring and evaluation. The Governing Council with stalwarts was formed. There were 9 members. The institute having no corpus started in a small way with the help of the staff of â€œPranava Industrial Services Pvt. Ltd. where Mr. P. J. Divatia is the Chairman and Managing Director. The first project undertaken was of women entrepreneursâ€™ development in villages of Viramgam Taluka Nabard assisted this project. Since then institution is involved in various activities of field research extension and training. In last two years it worked very closely with, The Hunger Project on various grass roots level programmes. Focused areas of activities The Institute since its inception in 1997 has been involved in various activities in the areas of extension, research and training relating to rural development. The Institute is in Socio-Economic research activities since its inception. It has completed some 21 research studies by now on behalf of various institutions and Government departments. The subjects include credit programmes, social forestry, training in agriculture, Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan, water and sanitation, literacy, marketing, education, Cottage industries, Disaster management etc. It is in the process of developing several innovative projects focusing on identification of income generation activities, developing proper linkages between community development activities and local institute, providing information base for planning of rural development programmes, identification of development opportunities etc. It is also focusing on popularizing some of new and sustainable technologies in rural areas. Sustainability of development is the main concern of the institution. It has a group of innovative young people who are interested in providing their intellectual inputs in rural development activities. The detailed list of activities carried out is provided at annexure-II). Infrastructure available We have all the necessary infrastructure facilities like building vehicles, computers, fax, internet, telephones, audio/video equipments, etc. along with around 1000 sq. ft. office space at Ahmedabad. Institutional Network We have a strong network with several institutes like Indian Society for Population Education (ISPE) and Indian Society for Community Education (ISCE) having their central office at Ahmedabad and local offices at Viramgam, Daskroi, Sanand and Dehgam Taluka. The Hunger project having its office at Ahmedabad and its Network with 65 NGOs spread all over Gujarat and also reputed Gandhian Institute like Gujarat Vidyapith, which has several rural campuses. The institute has also National Network with several institutes in Mumbai and New Delhi.
